page.title: 04YORKS OF COGENHOE.
page.content: {York Brothers Coaches}have been serving thousands of Northamptonians for many years. In the last 60 years or so the firm has grown from a horse and cart to a fleet of{58 vehicles.}In 1924, their first motor vehicle _ a Model 'T' Ford was used to carry coal. Also at that time, on market days, for{6d}one could travel to Northampton. The firm saw a period of steady expansion from 1920 until the Second World War; in{1928 the first summer express was started _ {Great Yarmouth!}During the war years there were requisitions from troops and munition workers. In 1974, Â£20,000 of damage was caused when a fire hit the workshops. While the fire was raging 30 coaches were driven to safety; fortuanately, there was no loss of life despite an {acetylene cylinder exploding.
